meanings.definition: Extradites: to hand over (a person accused or convicted of a crime) to the jurisdiction of the foreign state in which the crime was committed.
meanings.sent1: The country extradites criminals to other nations for trial.
meanings.sent2: The government extradites suspects who have committed crimes abroad.
meanings.sent3: The police officer joked that he would extradite the mischievous cat to the neighboring town.
meanings.sent4: The teacher extradites any disruptive behavior to the principal's office.
meanings.sent5: The superhero extradites villains to the secret underground prison.

meanings.definition: Extradites: to deliver up or extradite (a fugitive) to the proper authorities.
meanings.sent1: The detective extradites the fugitive to face justice in the correct jurisdiction.
meanings.sent2: The court orders to extradite the escaped criminal to the authorities.
meanings.sent3: The chef humorously said he would extradite the missing ingredients to the pantry.
meanings.sent4: The captain extradites any stowaways to the port authorities.
meanings.sent5: The explorer extradites the ancient artifact to the museum for safekeeping.
